intro: Marcellia denudata, commonly known as the naked marcellia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in wetland habitats such as swamps and marshes. Marcellia denudata is often found in association with other wetland plants and is adapted to saturated soil conditions.
